glsa.title: Adobe Acrobat Reader: Buffer overflow vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: Adobe Acrobat Reader is vulnerable to a buffer overflow that could lead to remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Adobe Acrobat Reader is a utility used to view PDF files.

description.p: A buffer overflow has been discovered in the UnixAppOpenFilePerform() function, which is called when Adobe Acrobat Reader tries to open a file with the "\Filespec" tag.

impact.p: By enticing a user to open a specially crafted PDF document, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: Since Adobe will most likely not update the 5.0 series of Adobe Acrobat Reader for Linux, all users should upgrade to the latest available version of the 7.0 series:
